Package org.openlca.core.database

Interface IDatabase

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable, INotifiable
All Known Implementing Classes:
Derby, MySQL
public interface IDatabase extends Closeable, INotifiable
The common interface for openLCA databases.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static int
    CURRENT_VERSION
    The current database schema version of this package.

  • Field Details

    • CURRENT_VERSION

      static final int CURRENT_VERSION
      The current database schema version of this package. Together with the getVersion-method this can be used to check for updates of a database.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • createConnection

      Connection createConnection()
      Creates a native SQL connection to the underlying database. The connection should be closed from the respective client.

    • getEntityFactory

      jakarta.persistence.EntityManagerFactory getEntityFactory()
      Returns the entity manager factory from the database.

    • newEntityManager

      default jakarta.persistence.EntityManager newEntityManager()
      Creates a new entity manager which should be closed when it is not needed anymore.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the database name.

    • getVersion

      int getVersion()

    • getFileStorageLocation

      File getFileStorageLocation()
      Get a location where external files that belongs this database are stored (e.g. PDF or Word documents, shapefiles etc). If there is no such location for such files for this database, an implementation can just return null.

    • clearCache

      default void clearCache()
      Clears the cache of the entity manager of this database. You should always call this method when you modified the database (via native SQL queries) outside of the entity manager.

    • getLibraries

      default Set<String> getLibraries()
      Get the IDs of libraries that are linked to this database.

    • hasLibraries

      default boolean hasLibraries()
      Returns true if there are libraries linked to this database.

    • addLibrary

      default void addLibrary​(String id)
      Registers the library with the given ID to this database. It is the task of the application layer to resolve the location of the corresponding library in the file system. Nothing is done if a library with this ID is already registered.

    • removeLibrary

      default void removeLibrary​(String id)
      Remove the library with the given ID from this database.

    • insert

      default <T extends AbstractEntity> T insert​(T e)

    • insert

      default void insert​(AbstractEntity e1, AbstractEntity e2, AbstractEntity... more)

    • update

      default <T extends AbstractEntity> T update​(T e)

    • delete

      default <T extends AbstractEntity> void delete​(T e)

    • delete

      default void delete​(AbstractEntity e1, AbstractEntity e2, AbstractEntity... more)

    • get

      default <T extends AbstractEntity> T get​(Class<T> type, long id)

    • getAll

      default <T extends AbstractEntity> List<T> getAll​(Class<T> type, gnu.trove.set.TLongSet ids)

    • get

      default <T extends RootEntity> T get​(Class<T> type, String refID)

    • getDescriptor

      default <T extends RootEntity> Descriptor getDescriptor​(Class<T> type, long id)
      Get the descriptor of the entity of the given type and ID.

    • getDescriptor

      default <T extends RootEntity> Descriptor getDescriptor​(Class<T> type, String refID)
      Get the descriptor of the entity of the given type and reference ID.

    • allOf

      default <T extends RootEntity> List<T> allOf​(Class<T> type)
      Get all entities of the given type from this database.

    • allDescriptorsOf

      default <T extends RootEntity> List<? extends Descriptor> allDescriptorsOf​(Class<T> type)
      Get the descriptors of all entities of the given type from this database.

    • forName

      default <T extends RootEntity> T forName​(Class<T> type, String name)
      Get the first entity of the given type and with the given name from the database. It returns `null` if no entity with the given name exists.

    • clear

      default void clear()
      Deletes everything from this database. We assume that you now what you do when calling this method.
